class website.tests.BaseApiTestCase(methodName='runTest')[source]

Bases: rest_framework.test.APITestCase

Contains most used functions in all test cases

assertEqualsForTwoDicts(response_data_dict, expected_data_dict)[source]
Params response_data_dict

response got after calling api

Params expected_data_dict

dict values we want to match for given dict

  eg:-
  response_data{
   "name":"vishal shekhar",
   "age":20
  }

  expected_data_dict = {
    "name":"aman saxena"
  }

this will match name of expected data with name key of response_data
assertKeyListInDict(response_dict, key_list)[source]

checks if given list of keys exist in provided dictionary

Params response_dict

response dictionary

Params key_list

list of keys to assert

post(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]

website.utils.climate_api_utils

class website.utils.climate_api_utils.ClimateApiUtil(parameter, ordering_type, region)[source]

Bases: object

get_climate_data()[source]

Forms url based on parameters and only calls api and returns climate api object.

on success sets _data and message and returns climate api object on failure sets errors(traceback for logging) and message then returns climate api object

get_formatted_data()[source]

Gets proper formatter based on order type and formats data

is_valid()[source]

will return true only if climate data api is fetched successfully. before returning true it will set __parser and parsed data in the current object

class website.utils.climate_api_utils.Formatter(ordering_type)[source]

Bases: object

format(data)[source]

calls approriate formatter based on order type

static get_formatter(ordering_type)[source]
Params ordering_type

values from farmsetu.type_class.OrderType

returns formatter object based on order type, implemented just for readability, in case different formatter classes are required those can be instantiated from here

ordering_type
class website.utils.climate_api_utils.Parser(ordering_type)[source]

Bases: object

Parses data based on order type

static get_parser(ordering_type)[source]

returns parser object.

Note

Parser object can be instantiated directly this is implemented just for readability or in case different Parser classes are meant to be instantiated based on parameters

ordering_type
parse(data)[source]

Calls appropriate parser based on order type
